author: Bengaluru Bureau
text:
Four days after a leopard entered a school in the city — with the visuals of the dramatic operation going viral on social media as well as carried in the international media — schools in the area have gradually started to open. Meanwhile, rumours and “fresh sightings” continue to circulate in the area.

While some schools ignored the Education Department direction to remain shut and functioned on Thursday; all are expected to function on Friday.

However, Vibgyor High at Marathahalli, the site of the tense operations on Sunday, will continue to remain closed. On Sunday morning, the furtive entry of the leopard was captured in CCTV cameras. When the forest department were called in, the leopard unexpectedly showed up at the school, and in panic attacked and injured two rescuers. The leopard was captured late in the evening.

Since then, however, rumours of ‘sightings’ of other leopards in the area, has seen fear envelop the residents there. The education department had even asked schools to stay shut. However, with no confirmation of a leopard, many private schools opened on Thursday.

Though more than 40 officials of the forest department have camped there since Monday, with extensive combing leading to naught, the calls have continued. Officials said there was no concrete confirmation of a leopard in the area. However, the hoax calls continued.

With rumours continuing to swirl around, the forest department have issued an advisory on what to do if a leopard is seen, as well as called for volunteers to tell the city “loud and clear” that leopards can coexist with humans.
title: New ‘leopard rumours’ do the rounds in Bengaluru
